attributes.action: Revoke closure of gyms during 2nd lockdown
attributes.additional_details: Closing this sector Unless needs must, makes no economic sense to furlough thousands, if it is not an factor in increased cases of COVID-19. Gyms have increased hygiene and cleanliness to abide by new standards. They are such a important roll in people’s lives for fitness wellbeing and mental health and the impact of their closure a second time seems far to drastic
attributes.background: Revoke the closure of gyms during lockdown or provide scientific evidence that they are a inconclusive factor in increased cases of COVID-19.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
